name: Rechercher des entreprises sur LinkedIn et les ajouter √† Airtable CRM
description:
# Rechercher des entreprises sur LinkedIn et les ajouter √† Airtable CRM

### Pour qui est-ce ?
Ce mod√®le est id√©al pour les √©quipes de vente, les professionnels du d√©veloppement commercial et les marketeurs cherchant √† construire une base de prospects robuste sans recherche manuelle sur LinkedIn. Parfait pour les agences, les consultants et les entreprises B2B ciblant des profils d'entreprise sp√©cifiques.

### Quel probl√®me ce flux de travail r√©sout-il ?
La recherche manuelle d'entreprises sur LinkedIn et leur ajout √† votre CRM est chronophage et sujette √† des erreurs. Cette automatisation √©limine le processus fastidieux de recherche, de qualification et d'importation de prospects dans votre base de donn√©es.

### Ce que fait ce flux de travail
Ce flux de travail recherche automatiquement des entreprises sur LinkedIn en fonction de vos crit√®res (mots-cl√©s, taille, emplacement), r√©cup√®re des informations d√©taill√©es sur chaque entreprise, les filtre en fonction des indicateurs de qualit√© (nombre de followers et disponibilit√© du site web), et ajoute de nouvelles entreprises √† votre Airtable CRM tout en √©vitant les doublons.

### Configuration
1. Cr√©ez un compte Ghost Genius API et obtenez votre cl√© API
2. Configurez les n≈ìuds de requ√™te HTTP avec les identifiants d'authentification par en-t√™te (Nom : "Authorization", Valeur : "Bearer your_api_key")
3. Cr√©ez une base Airtable nomm√©e "CRM" avec les colonnes : nom, site web, LinkedIn, id, etc.
4. Configurez vos identifiants Airtable en suivant la documentation n8n
5. Ajoutez vos crit√®res de s√©lection de recherche d'entreprise au n≈ìud ‚ÄúSet Variables‚Äù.

### Comment personnaliser ce flux de travail
- Modifiez les param√®tres de recherche dans le n≈ìud "Set Variables" pour cibler diff√©rentes industries, emplacements ou tailles d'entreprise
- Ajustez le seuil du nombre de followers dans le n≈ìud "Filter Valid Companies" en fonction de vos crit√®res de qualification
- Personnalisez le mappage des champs Airtable dans le n≈ìud "Add Company to CRM" pour correspondre √† la structure de votre base de donn√©es
- Ajoutez des n≈ìuds de notification (Slack, Email) pour vous alerter lorsque de nouvelles entreprises sont ajout√©es

workflow.name: Search LinkedIn companies, Score with AI and add them to Google Sheet CRM

parameters.content:
## LinkedIn Company Search
This section initiates the workflow and searches for your target companies on LinkedIn using the Ghost Genius API. 

You can filter and refine your search using keywords, company size, location, industry, or even whether the company has active job postings. Use the "Set Variables" node for it.

Note that you can retrieve a maximum of 1000 companies per search (corresponding to 100 LinkedIn pages), so it's important not to exceed this number of results to avoid losing prospects.

**Example:** Let's say I want to target Growth Marketing Agencies with 11-50 employees. I do my search and see that there are 10,000 results. So I refine my search by using location to go country by country and retrieve all 10,000 results in several batches ranging from 500 to 1000 depending on the country.

**Tips:** To test the workflow or to see the number of results of your search, change the pagination parameter (Max Pages) in the "Search Companies" node. It will be displayed at the very top of the response JSON.

## Company Data Processing 
This section processes each company individually.

We retrieve all the company information using Get Company Details by using the LinkedIn link obtained from the previous section.

Then we filter the company based on the number of followers, which gives us a first indication of the company's credibility (200 in this case), and whether their LinkedIn page has a website listed.

The workflow implements batch processing with a 2-second delay between requests to respect API rate limits. This methodical approach ensures reliable data collection while preventing API timeouts.

You can adjust these thresholds based on your target market - increasing the follower count for more established businesses or decreasing it for emerging markets.

## CRM Integration
This section handles the Airtable CRM integration.

It first checks if the company already exists in your database (using LinkedIn ID) to prevent duplicates because when you do close enough searches, some companies may come up several times.

If it's a new company, it adds the record to Airtable with comprehensive details including name, LinkedIn URL, website, tagline, description, and category. 

The workflow automatically tags companies as 'Growth Marketing Agency 11-50 üåç' and sets the country to 'üá∫üá∏ United States' (customize according to your use case).

## Introduction
Welcome to my template! Before explaining how to set it up, here's some important information:

This automation is very easy to implement and is designed for anyone wanting to build and enrich a solid CRM through LinkedIn research.

The initial data source can be changed as long as you have the LinkedIn URL of the company.

For any questions, you can send me a DM on my [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/matthieu-belin83/) :)

## Setup
- Create an account on [Ghost Genius API](https://ghostgenius.fr) and get your API key.

- Configure the Search Companies and Get Company Info modules by creating a "Header Auth" credential:
**Name: "Authorization"**
**Value: "Bearer api_key"**
üé• Watch the setup API Key video juste [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=12nLy8GWSlE).

- Create an Airtable base named "CRM" and add at least the following columns: name (default), website (url), LinkedIn (url), id (number).

- Configure your Airtable credential by following the n8n documentation.

- Add your company search selection criteria to the ‚ÄúSet Variables‚Äù node.

## Tools 
**(You can use the API and CRM of your choice; this is only a suggestion)**

- API Linkedin : [Ghost Genius API](https://ghostgenius.fr) 

- API Documentation : [Documentation](https://ghostgenius.fr/docs)

- CRM : [Airtable](https://airtable.com)

- LinkedIn Location ID Finder : [Ghost Genius Locations ID Finder](https://ghostgenius.fr/tools/search-sales-navigator-locations-id)

assignments.name: B: 1-10 employees, C: 11-50 employees, D: 51-200 employees, E: 201-500 employees, F: 501-1000 employees, G: 1001-5000 employees, H: 5001-10,000 employees, I: 10,001+ employees

parameters.value: ={{ $json['B: 1-10 employees, C: 11-50 employees, D: 51-200 employees, E: 201-500 employees, F: 501-1000 employees, G: 1001-5000 employees, H: 5001-10,000 employees, I: 10,001+ employees'] }}

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
